results.creator_credit: Allan Miller, Music Project for Television Inc and Pyramid Films

results.title: The Secret hunger
results.creator_credit: Gene Lawrence, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Illustrates the struggle of people against want and hunger as the pattern of life is traced from birth and childhood in Latin America, through marriage in Africa, adulthood in Asia and Indonesia. Problems impeding greater agricultural productivity are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Lawrence, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Secret garden [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Tom Luddy, Fred Roos, Fred Fuchs, American Zoetrope and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Frances Hodgson Burnett’s timeless tale “The Secret garden” has been stunningly recreated for the screen by the famed director of “Europa Europa”, Agnieszka Holland. Mary is a spoilt brat sent to England after her parents die in India. Her uncle’s house is forbidding and silent, and the housekeeper (Maggie Smith) is grim. Mary, unaccustomed to doing things for herself, is placed in the care of Martha the maid, who introduces Mary to her brother Dickon, a boy who can charm wild animals. Together, they discover a secret walled garden and a special friendship. The house also hides another secret and Mary discovers her crippled cousin Colin; an over-indulged, selfish child with an iron will equal her own. Mary, Dickon and Colin nurse not only the garden but the inmates of the house back to health. This film has excellent performances from the youthful cast of Kate Maberly, Heydon Prowse and Andrew Knott and is beautifully shot and costumed.

results.title: The Secret garden [Animated]
results.creator_credit: Dave Edwards, Ellen Freyer, Mike Young and Greengrass Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Frances Hodgson Burnett’s classic novel, this enchanting musical animated feature brings the story to life for yet another generation to cherish. Featuring radiant songs and a distinguished cast of voices, including Sir Derek Jacobi, Honor Blackman, Glynis Johns, Victor Spinetti and Frank Weller, this is quality entertainment for young viewers.

results.title: The Secret garden (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fred M Wilcox, Clarence Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful dramatisation based on the well-known children’s book of the same name. A young girl comes to live in a run down Victorian estate and finds an abandoned garden which she cares for. She befriends the young crippled son of the house - with amazing results. Starring Margaret O’Brien and Dean Stcokwell.

results.title: The Secret Files of J. Edgar Hoover
results.creator_credit: Jerry Kupcinet, Joseph Honig and Western International Syndication
results.brief_description: All personalities whose actions shaped 20th century America, and all unwitting stars in an infamous production are now revealed for the very first time in “The secret files of J. Edgar Hoover”. Power, fear, influence - serving under 8 presidents, he was accountable to none. Politicians came and went, but Hoover remained, a public servant who died a millionaire.
results.title_for_label: The Secret Files of J. Edgar Hoover
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Kupcinet, Joseph Honig and Western International Syndication

results.title: The Secret Discovery of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This film reveals evidence which clearly shows that the Portuguese were on Australian soil long before either the Dutch or the English - in fact 250 years before Captain Cook. It is a story of spies and political espionage, resulting from the mantle of secrecy the Portuguese threw around their explorations and discoveries, and the efforts of their European counterparts to steal their maps.

results.title: The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling book by Sue Townsend, “The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole”, aged 13 3/4 years, is a funny, bitter-sweet comedy that will bring back those painful but amusing memories of growing up. Stars Julie Walters. Rated: PG
